articles.author: Ari Rabinovitch, Enas Alashray
articles.description: Israeli fighter jets struck Houthi military targets in the area of Hodeidah port in Yemen on Saturday, the Israeli military said, a day after a drone launched by the Iranian-backed group hit Israel's economic hub Tel Aviv.
articles.title: Israeli jets strike Houthi targets in Yemen after Tel Aviv attack

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Jeff Mason
articles.description: The crisis-in-confidence in Biden's ability to win has placed a huge spotlight on Kamala Harris, widely believed to be the most likely replacement if he steps down.
articles.title: VP Harris hits fundraising trail amid ongoing calls for Biden to quit race

articles.author: Jonathan Saul, Simon Lewis
articles.description: Ruth Lieberman, a Jewish settler in the Israeli occupied West Bank, is determined to thwart international pressure for a sovereign Palestinian state. And her friendships with prominent U.S. Republicans from the party's religious right are helping, she says.
articles.title: Israeli settlers court Republican religious right after Hamas attacks

articles.author: John Kruzel
articles.description: The bullet came less than a quarter of an inch from entering Trump's head, Ronny Jackson said.
articles.title: Trump's former physician gives new details on gunshot wound

articles.author: Sam Jahan
articles.description: Bangladesh soldiers patrolled Dhaka's deserted streets on Saturday amid a curfew to quell deadly students-led protests against government job quotas that have killed more than 100 people this week.
articles.title: Bangladesh army enforces curfew as student-led protests spiral

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Air raid sirens wailed across Cyprus's ethnically-split capital Nicosia at dawn on Saturday as Greek Cypriots mourned, and Turkish Cypriots celebrated 50 years since Turkey invaded part of the island in response to a brief Greek-inspired coup.
articles.title: One part mourns, another celebrates as Cyprus marks 50 years since split

articles.author: Tim Reid
articles.description: Donald Trump will hold his first campaign rally on Saturday since he narrowly escaped an assassination attempt one week ago and fresh from his nominating convention where his takeover of the Republican Party was cemented.
articles.title: Trump to hold first campaign rally after assassination attempt
Trump said Xi wrote 'beautiful note' after assassination attempt

articles.author: Tim Hepher
articles.description: The U.S. will closely dissect its plans for a Next Generation Air Dominance (NGAD) platform - a future family of fighters and drones - before deciding whether to go ahead, Secretary of the Air Force Frank Kendall said on Saturday.
articles.title: US to take 'hard look' at fighter project, top official says

articles.author: Marco Trujillo, Elizabeth Pineau
articles.description: A police officer and five protesters were injured on Saturday when violence erupted during a demonstration in the French grains port of La Rochelle over the use of reservoirs to supply large-scale agriculture, local officials said.
articles.title: French police clash with reservoir protesters in La Rochelle
